title: Arbroath Smokie Soup

ingredients.content: 50 g leeks, white part, cut in pieces
50 g unsmoked bacon, cut in pieces (optional)
150 g Arbroath smokie, bones and skin removed, cut in pieces (3 cm)
1 tsp fine sea salt, or to taste
½ tsp ground black pepper, or to taste

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 170°C. Place tomatoes in a roasting dish, then drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with sugar and thyme leaves. Roast for 20 minutes (170°C). Meanwhile, continue with recipe.
Place butter, shallots, leeks, bacon (if using) and garlic in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then cook <b>3 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.

Add Arbroath Smokie or smoked haddock, roasted tomatoes together with juices, tomato purée, stock, lemon juice, balsamic vinegar, paprika, salt and pepper then cook <b>12 min/100°C/speed 2<b>. Blend <b>2 min/speed 10<b>.
Add cream and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Taste and add extra seasoning if needed before serving hot.

hintsAndTricks: This delicately flavoured soup would be equally at home on the table of a fine restaurant, as a starter at a dinner party, or as a lunch served with crusty bread. You can substitute smoked mackerel or kippers for the Arbroath Smokie if you wish - all are oily fish which are rich in vitamins A and D and omega-3 fatty acids.
Serves 6 for lunch or 8 as a starter.
